security: Sharing specific assignments like "Italy-Rome," "London," and "Japan" and relationships with individuals (Jim & Elsie) could expose operational details and put individuals at risk. Quoting directly: "Italy-Rome", "12yrs London", "Japan", "friends of Jim & Elsie".
summary: These notes, taken on 24 March 1978, document an interview or review related to James S. Woods and potential connections to the Lee Harvey Oswald (LHO) - CIA allegations.
summary_one_paragraph: These notes, dated March 24, 1978, appear to be from an internal CIA review or interview concerning James S. Woods (DOB Feb 2, 1928). The notes include details about Woods' service history in locations such as Italy, London and Japan. The notes address whether Woods had heard of the LHO-CIA allegation in Japan and whether he has discussed this issue with his wife. The notes also mention individuals named Jim & Elsie and Louise and her relation to discussion with The Wilcols.
title: Notes on James S. Woods
